VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_Predict_F32

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_Predict_F32 (VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32 *KF)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_Predict_F32 ( VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32 *  KF  ) 

Description:
The state of the Kalman filter is defined using the following structure (the expected bit precision for each matrix is noted in the comments). The variable sD and mD represent the dimensionality of the state and measurement vectors and have values of 12 and 4 respectively. 
typedef struct VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32{

    VLIB_F32 transition[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];          // state transition matrix
    VLIB_F32 errorCov[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];            // a priori error covariance matrix
    VLIB_F32 predictedErrorCov[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];   // predicted error covariance matrix
    VLIB_F32 state[sD_4x12];                      //state of the process
    VLIB_F32 predictedState[sD_4x12];             // predicted state of the process
    VLIB_F32 measurement[mD_4x12*sD_4x12];         // measurement matrix (relating state to measurement)
    VLIB_F32 processNoiseCov[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];     // process noise covariance matrix
    VLIB_F32 measurementNoiseCov[mD_4x12*mD_4x12]; // measurement noise covariance matrix
    VLIB_F32 kalmanGain[sD_4x12*mD_4x12];          // Kalman gain
    VLIB_F32 temp1[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];
    VLIB_F32 temp2[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];
    VLIB_F32 temp3[sD_4x12*sD_4x12];
    int32_t tempBuffers[mD_4x12*mD_4x12*2];
    int32_t scaleFactor;
    // Scales the matrix M = (H*P1*H' + R) to ensure that its inverse
    //  does not overflow 32 bits.
    //  The scaling is done by right shifting each element of M by the
    // quantity assigned to scaleFactor.
    //  The computed inverse is then scaled back to ensure the correct result
    //  based on the identity inv(M) = inv(M/k)/k
} VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32;
In VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_Predict_F32, input and output are VLIB_F32 type
Parameters:
[in,out] *KF Pointer to struct VLIB_kalmanFilter_4x12_F32
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C66x floating-point processors
